data.title: Shows: Pete Eckert
data.meta_description: Blind photographer Pete Eckert's shows listed chronologically.
data.text:
Shows

2020

January 24 – February 25

“Recoding Crip Tech”, SOMARTS Cultural Center, San Francisco, California.

2019

January

“Shot in the Dark” Museum Kultursgpeicher, Würzburg, Germany https://www. kulturspeicher.de/. There was a photo gallery show accompanying the film.

2018

December

“Shot in the Dark” This Human World International Film festival , Vienna, Austria. There was a photo gallery show accompanying the film.

2017

March 17

“Shot in the Dark” One World Film Festival, Prague,Czech Republic. There was a photo gallery show accompanying the film.

January 17

“Shot in the Dark” Brotfabrik Galerie, Caligariplatz 1, 13086 Berlin, Germany. There was a photo gallery show accompanying the film.

May 10 – August 13

“ArtsAbled: Seeing the Unseen”, Triton Museum of Art, Santa Clara, California

January 12-15

Blind Photographer’s Guild, Photo LA: The 26th International Los Angeles Photographic Art Exposition. The Reef/LA MART Downtown, Los Angeles, California.

October 15, 2016-January 8, 2017

“Sight Unseen, International Photography by Blind Artists”. Huntington Museum of Art, Huntington, West Virginia.

2016

May 25-September 11

IV Bienal De Arte Contempraneo, Fundacion Once, Madrid, Spain.

Feb-September 18

“Sight Unseen: International Photography by Blind Artists”, Canadian Museum of Human Rights, Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada.

2015

October-November

“Freeze Frame”, Coker Art Gallery, Roseville, CA. Juried Show.

October

Photography Exposure Gallery, Freeport, Maine.

January 28-March 14

“Forest Ballet” Society for the Blind, Sacramento, California.

January 15-18

Blind Photographer’s Guild, Photo LA: The 24th International Los Angeles Photographic Art Exposition. LA MART Downtown, Los Angeles, California.

2014

May 17-June 17

Echoes / Photomonth in Kradow 2014 Festival. Galeria Sztuki Współczesnej Bunkier Sztuki pl. Szczepański 3a, 31-011 Kraków, Poland

May 21-22

“Seeing Without Seeing” Presentation at the 11th Annual Seoul Digital Forum (SDF) Innovative Wisdom: Technology for the Common Good, Dongdaemun Design Plaza, Seoul, Korea. www.seouldigitalforum.org

January 16-19

Photo LA: The 23rd International Los Angeles Photographic Art Exposition. LA MART Downtown Los Angeles. Blind Photographer’s Guild.

2013

April 18-June 3, 2013

“Sight Unseen: International Photography by Blind Artists,” Sejong Center Seoul, South Korea. www.curatorial.com

April 4-7

Seoul Photo 2013 “Sight Unseen: International Photography by Blind Artists,” Coex Convention Center and Exhibition Halls in Gangnam, \ Seoul, South Korea.

September 23

Issuance of Pete’s “Electro Man” stamp at a press conference at the United Nations High-level meetings of the 68th Session of the General Assembly, New York www.un.org

April 23-24

Swarovski LINK Jewelry Summit, Vienna, Austria.

January 17-21

photo la: The 22st Annual International Los Angeles Photographic Art Exposition. Santa Monica Civic Center Auditoruim. Pete Eckert, Bruce Hall, and Alice Wingwall, Blind Photographer’s Guild.

2012

January 14 — February 11

“Sight Unseen: International Photography by Blind Artists’, Centro Fotográfico Manuel Álvarez Bravo Photographic Center, Oaxaca, Mexico

January 12-16

Photo LA 2012, the 21st Annual International Los Angeles Photographic Art Exposition. The Blind Photographers Guild. Santa Monica California www.photola.com

December 22, 2012 – March 2013

Naples Museum of Art, Naples, FL. Sight Unseen: International Photography by Blind Artists.

September 13

“Visions2 Art by the Blind” Fundraiser for the Foundation Fighting Blindness, Sacramento, California

2011

Oct. 8-11, 2011

“I Can’t See My Art Work.” A Bitchin” Space, Sacramento, California

Oct 5

Photography Fall 2011 Artist Lecture Series. American River College, Sacramento, California.

September 28-Oct. 28

“Third Annual Celebration of Life” group show 1855 Gallery, Davis, California

September 21

“Artists With a Vision” benefit for the AFB Center on Vision Loss. Samuel Lynne Galleries. Dallas, Texas.

September 14 — November 6, 2011

“Sight Unseen: International Photography by Blind Artists’, Fototeca de Nuevo León, Monterrey, Mexico

May 1—31, 2011

Solo Show, 1855 Gallery, Davis, California

March 24 — May 4, 2011

“Sight Unseen: International Photography by Blind Artists’, Biblioteca Vasconcelos, Mexico City

March 3 through April 9, 2011

“Sight Unseen: International Photography by Blind Artists’, Center for Visual Arts, Metropolitan State College of Denver, Denver, Colorado. www.metrostatecva.org

January 20 — March 5, 2011

“Sight Unseen: International Photography by Blind Artists’, Galeria De Arte, Universidad Iberoamericana, Puebla, Mexico

January 2011

Photo LA 2011, the 20th Annual International Los Angeles Photographic Art Exposition. Blind Photographers Guild, Santa Monica, CA. www.photola.com

2010

Dec. 3-16, 2010

“Sight Unseen: International Photography by Blind Artists’, Flacon Gallery, Moscow, Russia.

November 1-30, 2010

Group show, 1855 Gallery, Davis, California

Sept 21 — 25, 2010

“Sight Unseen: International Photography by Blind Artists’, Centro Regional de las Artes de Michoacán, Zamora, Mexico

Sep. 16-Nov. 7, 2010

“Fundacion Once III Bienal De Arte Contemporaneo’, Madrid, Spain.

Jun. 10-Aug. 8, 2010

“La Mirada Invisible: Colectiva Internacional De Fotógrafos Ciegos” Centro de la Imagen, Mexico City, Mexico.

June 16, 2009

LADIG.org meeting presents: The Art of Seeing with Bruce Hall and Pete Eckert. For more information go to ladig.org

May 31-Jun. 2010

The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, Washington, DC showing of “Sight Unseen: International Photography by Blind Artists’, Exhibition presentation designed by Michael Graves & Associates. VSA presents Exhibitions at The Kennedy Center.

January 2010

Photo LA 2010, the 19th Annual International Los Angeles Photographic Art Exposition. Blind Photographers Guild, Santa Monica, CA. www.photola.com

2009

June 16, 2009

LADIG.org meeting presents: The Art of Seeing with Bruce Hall and Pete Eckert. For more information go to ladig.org

May-Aug. 2009

“Sight Unseen,” International Photography by Blind Artists. The California Museum of Photography, UCR, Riverside, CA. www.cmp.ucr.edu

April 14

Presentation at Apple Headquarters in Cupertino, CA.

Feb.-Mar. 2009

“Creative Vision: An Exhibition on Vision and Perception,” LH Horton Jr Gallery, Stockton CA. www.deltacollege.edu

January 2009

Photo LA 2009. Blind Photographers Guild, Santa Monica, CA. www.artfairsinc.com/photola/2009/

2008

Oct.-Dec.

Insights 2008, SF Arts Commission Gallery at City Hall, San Francisco, CA. Juried Show. www.lighthouse-sf.org

Sep.-Oct.

“Circus Show and Other Atrocities” Verge Gallery, Sacramento, CA.

August

“Pete Eckert: Exposure,” Leo Kesting Gallery, New York, NY. Juried Show. www.artistswanted.org

January

Photo LA 2008. View From Here. Santa Monica, CA.

2007

2007-2008

Art Ark, A traveling art show sponsored by the Crocker Museum, Sacramento, CA.

Oct.-Dec. 2007

Insights 2007, SF Arts Commission Gallery at City Hall, San Francisco, CA. Juried Show.

September 2007

Visions, Sacramento Foundation Fighting Blindness, Sacramento, CA.

2007

“Light Show,”A Bitchin Space, Sacramento, CA., A collaborative show.

May-Jun. 2007

Art Auction 2007, Crocker Art Museum, Sacramento, CA.

Nov.-Dec. 2007

“Fire Water,” Toy Room Gallery, Sacramento, CA.

2006

June 2006

Art Auction 2006, Crocker Art Museum, Sacramento, CA.

July 2006

Photo SF, The 7th International photo-based art exposition, Fort Mason, San Francisco, CA.

Feb.-Mar. 2006

James Kaneko Gallery, Sacramento, CA.

Aug.-Oct. 2006

Insights 2006, SF Arts Commission Gallery at City Hall, San Francisco, CA. Juried Show.

2005

Aug.-Oct. 2005

“16th Exhibit,” Insights 2005, SF Arts Commission Gallery at City Hall, San Francisco, CA. Juried Show

Oct.-Dec. 2005

Roseville Arts 30th Annual Open Show, Roseville, CA, Juried Show.

2005

“Pete Eckert Photographs by a Blind Man,” The Badé Museum, Berekely, CA. Solo show.

July 2005

Photo San Francisco 2005, The View From Here, Fort Mason, SF, CA.

June 2005

Art Auction 2005, Crocker Art Museum, Sacramento, CA.

April 2005

“Photo,” Varnish Fine Arts, San Francisco, CA.

2004

July 2004

Photo San Francisco 2004, The View From Here, Fort Mason, SF, CA.

Aug.-Oct. 2004

“Art Exhibit 15th Year,” Insights, 2004, SF Arts Commission Gallery at City Hall, San Francisco, CA. Juried Show.

July 2004

One man show, Infinity Photographics, Sacramento, CA.

June 2004

Art Auction 2004, Crocker Art Museum, Sacramento, CA.

June 2004

Exploding Head Gallery, Sacramento, CA.

Feb. 2004

“Naïve Perceptions,” Exploding Head Gallery, Sacramento, CA.

2003

October 2003

“Global Art Look,” 2003 International Juried Show, Matrix Arts, Sacramento, CA

October 2003

“Calaca The Skeleton Show,” Art Pimp Gallery, Sacramento, CA.

Jul.-Sep. 2003

Insights 2003, SF Arts Commission Gallery at City Hall, San Francisco, CA. Juried Show.

July 2003

“Hybrid Photography,” Chiaroscuro Gallery, Santa Fe, New Mexico.

June 2003

“Phoenix Show,” Matrix Arts, Sacramento, CA.

June 2003

Art Auction 2003, Crocker Art Museum, Sacramento, CA.

April 2003

“Aperture,” Matrix Arts, Sacramento, CA. Juried Show.

April 2003

Exploding Head Gallery, Sacramento, CA.

2002

October 2002

“73rd Crocker Kingsley,” Crocker Art Museum, Sacramento, CA, Juried Show.

August 2002

“15th Annual Photography Competion,” Roseville Arts Center, Roseville, CA.

July 2002

Insights 2002, San Francisco Arts Commission Gallery at City Hall, San Francisco, CA. Juried Show.

July 2002

“Black & White Art Show,” True Love Coffee House, Sacramento, CA.

2001

December 2001

Torch Club, Sacramento, CA.

May 2001

Camera Arts, Sacramento, CA.
